newsitem.title: USA: LSB Fin'l in settlement; reserve adequate.
newsitem.headline: LSB Fin'l in settlement; reserve adequate.

text.p: LSB Financial Corp said Wednesday it signed settlement agreements with the trustee in bankruptcy for the Bennett Funding Group, Syracuse, N.Y.
LSB said it is satisfied the $800,000 loss provision it set aside last year will be adequate to absorb any losses that can be reasonably foreseen with these agreements.

One agreement applies to equipment leases with balances totaling $1,535,000. The agreement provides for the repayment of all of the proceeds from $1.4 million of leases that are current and not in default. This amount will be on loan for 30 months at a minimal interest rate to a company formerly controlled by the Bennett family and currently managed by the trustee in bankruptcy.

A second agreement deals with the leases of $855,000 that are currently in default. These leases are secured by equipment being used by an investment firm in New York City. Under this agreement, the bank will receive 78-1/2 percent of the funds collected, less some costs.
In another development, LSB said it completed the latest repurchase of five percent of its shares. The company bought back 45,888 shares in the open market over a one year period.
LSB Financial is the parent company of Lafayette Savings Bank.
